content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is an example implementation of the `add_yearmonth` function in Julia:

```julia
using DataFrames

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df.ym = map(x -> yearmonth(x), df.dt)
    return df
end

function yearmonth(dt)
    year = Dates.year(dt)
    month = Dates.month(dt)
    return year * 100 + month
end
```

You can call this function by passing your DataFrame as an argument, like this:

```julia
df = DataFrame(dt = [Dates.DateTime(2021, 10, 15), Dates.DateTime(2022, 5, 20)])
add_yearmonth(df)
```

This will add a new column `ym` to `df` that contains the concatenated year and month in the format "yyyymm".
